data.name: 13.Five Ofest
data.description: A German-style Oktoberfest Lagerbier. Toasted malt tones with light hopping from the classic German Mittelfrüh variety. The name refers to the German "Stammwürze” law which states in part that only beer with a minimum of 13.5% Stammwürze (a gravity measurement of wort) is allowed to be served in this Oktoberfest festival. 24 IBUs, 6.0% ABV.

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Blue Mountain Brewery
breweries.description:
Blue Mountain Brewery sits in the shadow of Appalachia's Blue Ridge Mountains in Afton, Virginia. We are a farm brewery, growing our own hops, and proudly craft real American beer inspired by thousands of years of tradition but not limited by convention.

Brewer Taylor Smack, previously head brewer for the Goose Island Brewing of Chicago brewpubs and South Street Brewery of Charlottesville, is now crafting his brews for the central Virginia area at the unique Blue Mountain Farm Brewery.

data.name: Aarghtoberfest
data.description: Our AARGHtoberfest! is a rich and toasty lager with a color reminiscent of the fallen leaves of October. A subdued earthy hop character helps to balance this malt forward beer. This beer is only available from August through September.

available.name: Fall
available.description: Available during the fall months.

breweries.name: Heavy Seas Beer
breweries.description:
Heavy Seas Beer is brewed by Clipper City Brewing Company, in Baltimore, Maryland. The brewery was established by Hugh Sisson in 1995. Previously, Sisson operated Maryland's first brewpub, Sisson's. The brewery is named for the famed Clipper ship - first developed and built in the home port of Baltimore. While the name of the company remains Clipper City Brewing Company, all of its beer falls under the Heavy Seas brand. Heavy Seas is located at 4615 Hollins Ferry Road, Suite B, in the Halethorpe section of Baltimore. Heavy Seas currently offers a variety of beer styles in approx. 18 states within the United States.

Heavy Seas mission is to bring back the local brewery, and to do it in such a way that we are more than just a fringe player, but a positive part of our area. To accomplish this mission we have created a broad portfolio of products with enough diversity that we have at least one beer that can appeal to everyone. Whether your preference is for a classic American style lager beer, or a big, challenging Hop Cubed Ale, we have a something that will suit your taste. We believe in bringing beer drinkers the quality and flavor of a handcrafted beer while supporting the local communities we serve.

breweries.description: From day one, every drop of Metro beer has been brewed and packaged by us, in our warehouse production brewery in the Ravenswood Industrial Corridor of Chicago. We're proud Chicagoans, honored to be offering up fresh lagers to the Chicagoland area.

data.name: Amerifest
data.description: Not a true Octoberfest, but a wonderful collaboration of American & European ingredients that results in a unique “fest” flavor profile with a California slant.

breweries.name: Aftershock Brewing Company
breweries.description:
After 27 years of steady brewing, we thought it would be fun to share the results of the brewing experience with others.  We are a small brewery, and are truly “hands on” every step of the brewing process.  Our goal is to produce the best, most flavorful, most memorable local beers possible.  We think we’ve met that goal, & hope you’ll agree.

At Aftershock, we believe there are two different approaches to brewing.  The most common approach used by the major breweries is a ‘scientific one’.  All stages of the brewing process are closely monitored to ensure a consistent, if tasteless product.  Computers and other high tech equipment are more in control than the brewer himself.  With this approach you get ‘scientific’ beer.  The other approach is a more artistic one, while still respecting basic laws of science, and the need for spotless cleanliness.  That’s the approach we plan to always take at Aftershock.  At the risk of losing an undetectable amount of consistency, the result is beer with much more character, subtle nuances, and awesome flavor.  Don’t take our word for it; check us out.

breweries.name: Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Located in beautiful Broad Ripple in Indianapolis, Indiana, Scotty's Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Company opened on January 17, 2011. Thr3e Wise Men will not only brew beer but will also be serving pizza, appetizers and desserts.
Thr3e Wise Men greets its guests with a classic lodge feel - exposed beams, concrete floors and warm wood walls.  Of course, Scotty prides himself on staying ahead of the technology curve and wanted to be the first one of the first Indiana restaurants to adorn dining room tables with Apple iPads so customers are able to learn more about Thr3e Wise Men Brewing Co., the beers, and Scotty's two other restaurant concepts.

data.name: Augtoberfest
data.description: This festbier is a celebration of Foolproof’s annual Augtoberfest festival, which we host at our brewery in Pawtucket, Rhode Island. Augtoberfest is brewed with caramel and Munich malt as well as American hops and is fermented cool to produce a clean, refreshing flavor. Prost!

breweries.name: Foolproof Brewing Company
breweries.description: Foolproof Brewing Company in Pawtucket, Rhode Island, produces high-quality, hand-crafted beers. Each of our beers is designed with a specific experience in mind.

data.name: Autumn Winds
data.description: This Oktoberfest-style ale, brewed with five premium German malts, create a bready aroma, dense creamy head and brilliant garnet red color. Hallertau and Saaz hops compliment the nutty and biscuit-like malt presence while a touch of caramel and moderately dry finish continue to balance out this full-bodied beer. Available September to November on draft only and in 16-ounce cans.

breweries.nameShortDisplay: Grey Sail Brewing of Rhode Island
breweries.description:
Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's newest microbrewery.

Proudly located in the seaside city of Westerly, Grey Sail Brewing of RI is southern Rhode Island's premier microbrewery equipped to produce up to 4,000 barrels of handcrafted beer per year.

data.name: Baderbräu Oktoberfest
data.description:
In 1810, the most memorable beer party ever (up to then) was thrown in honor of a Bavarian king. Since then, this party has been observed annually in Munich, going on to became the world-famous beer extravaganza known as Oktoberfest.

We expect many of you are planning to throw even more memorable parties this season. We have the perfect beer for these celebrations: In line with tradition, this 2013 Lisle Ale Fest People’s-Choice winner is an amber-colored, single-decocted, easy-drinking lager with a rich, malty flavor.

This Oktoberfest, make some great memories with Baderbrau Oktoberfest and friends. Raise a glass and toast with us. Prost!

data.name: Beck’s Oktoberfest
data.description: This seasonal specialty is brewed in limited quantities. Beck’s brewmasters create the distinctive, malty-sweet, amber-colored brew so people throughout the world can celebrate the season popularly known in Germany as Oktoberfest.

breweries.name: Begyle Brewing
breweries.description:
Begyle Brewing is a Community Supported Brewery, located in the Ravenswood Industrial Corridor, Chicago, IL.

Using a CSA (community supported agriculture) model, we will supply beer to our members via monthly subscriptions (referred to as a CSB or Beer-CSA!). In addition to the growler subscriptions we will offer growler fills to walk up customers through our retail space, as well as kegs and bottle for sale. We source many of our hops locally, you can expect the majority of our beers to include locally grown hops from Wisconsin and Michigan. We have lots of other things up our sleeves, too, like using spent grain for dog treats and sharing our space with local artists.

data.name: Blaketoberfest
data.description: This malt-forward Märzen was brewed using 100% German ingredients. Expect sweet honey notes blended with toasty and nutty flavors that are balanced with a subtle hop addition that makes this brew a perfect beer for bringing in the fall season.

breweries.name: Fifty West Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Thank you for your interest in Fifty West Brewing Company. Here is a little rundown about what Fifty West is all about:

All the beers brewed at Fifty West Brewing Company have been hand made in small batches with a focus on craftsmanship, tradition, innovation, and patience.

There are several reasons why we selected the name ‘Fifty West’; the most obvious being the fact that our brewery is located on Route 50, which extends from Coast to Coast- it spans more than 3,000 miles starting in Maryland and stretching all the way to California. 

The brewery is located in a building that has a vast and varied transient history (http://www.cincinnati.com/dining/heritage/history.html); from the settlers heading west through the Ohio River valley, to the days of Prohibition when our building was a favorite of George Remus and the bootleggers running whiskey from Cincinnati to Chicago, to where we are today—amidst a renaissance of the craft beer movement.

To us, it’s not about the destination, but instead making sure we are enjoying the journey, appreciating the moment, and brewing beers that are enjoyed by anyone who is willing to let us become a part of their journey.

breweries.name: Atwater Brewery
breweries.description: Atwater Block Brewery, founded in 1997, is housed in a 1916 factory warehouse located in Detroit's historic Rivertown district. Brewing relentlessly on our imported Kaspar Schultz system, we've ridden the wave of aggressive ales while holding true to our German roots through our traditional Lagers. With drinkability and tradition at heart, it's easy for us to "Drink Our Share and Sell the Rest"!

data.name: Bomber Marzen
data.description: Marzen means "March" beer but you may prefer to enjoy this august, medium-bodied German lager all year round. A smooth maltiness and clean, dry finish make this the perfect bier for all occasions - any time of the year!

breweries.name: Bomber Brewing
breweries.description: I suppose you could say it's a truly Canadian story - hockey, friendship and beer. From the ice rink to the brewery, Bomber Brewing is the shared dream of three friends with a passion for playing hockey and savouring good beer.   We drafted a team, combined our skills, and in February of 2014, we launched one of the newest micro-breweries to hit the Vancouver scene.

breweries.name: Boxcar Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Boxcar Brewing Company is a community-oriented brewing company providing fine crafted beer to be enjoyed with family and friends.
The idea for Box Car Brewing Company originated in 2006 in Tennessee at the wedding of two of its chief members Jason and Kristen Kohser. In the mountains of Tennessee gathered a very small group of friends and family including Jason’s cousin Kymberly and her then boyfriend Jamie Robinson. After an intimate ceremony, the entire group enjoyed a reception complete with homemade guacamole and a tub full of crudely marked “homebrews” prepared by Jason. Prior to this, he had been working in high-end restaurants as a general manager, bartender and food server for over 20 years. He spent several years in Northern California learning the fine art of winemaking at a local winery in Sonoma. During this time Jason realized the beauty of brewing beer and his desire to share his creation(s) with others. He’s been brewing out of his kitchen sink for several years now, slowly perfecting his recipes, offering to teach others the art, and, most importantly, making and drinking some real good beer. Jamie, who has yet to find a brew he will not try, immediately was interested in Jason’s creations and quickly started picking his brain on the processes and formalities for creating these “homebrews”. While sucking down a few well-crafted brews in the hot sun, Jamie and Jason talked about their love of beer and the groundwork was laid.

A few months later, Jamie received a phone call from Jason, who had been mulling over the possibility of moving forward with the beer making, he then proposed the idea of moving to Pennsylvania. Jason asked if Jamie would be interested in working together and the dream of opening a brewery was declared. In 2007, Jason and his wife moved to West Chester, PA where many of his family live. Together with the other three members the idea was hatched to get serious and start brewing beer on a larger scale, for the beer lovers in Chester County, PA. Box Car Brewing Company became a reality.

data.name: Brookside Lager
data.description: A pale lager beer made without the darker malts that we use in Roslyn Beer. It is hopped primarily with Yakima Hallertau hops, and may remind you of a beer you might find at a small gasthaus in Germany. It is especially popular with people who like full-bodied, lighter beers with mild hopping, and is named for the Brookside neighborhood of Roslyn.

available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

breweries.name: Roslyn Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Roslyn Brewing Company has been brewing hand-crafted and full-flavored beers in the old world tradition since 1990. Our beers are excellent, full-bodied, German-style lagers reminiscent of those brewed by the immigrant miners in our hometown of Roslyn, Washington at the turn of the century. We use only the finest ingredients, including malted barley grown in the Northwest, hops grown in the Yakima Valley, and ice cold snow-fed water from the heart of the Cascades, to produce a full-bodied brew with a flavor that some say has been missing in domestic beers since the enactment of Prohibition.
Our goal is to continue Roslyn's tradition of brewing excellence and bring it to beer lovers everywhere. Try one of our signature lagers today in our taproom or at your local watering hole. We think you will agree that you can taste the tradition of quality.

locations.name: Roslyn Brewing Company
locations.hoursOfOperation: Thursday, 1:00 PM - 6:00 PM, Friday and Saturday, 12:00 Noon - 8:00 PM, and on Sunday from 12:00 Noon until 5:00 PM .

data.name: California Buckwheat Oktoberfest
data.description: Inspired by the season we took advantage of the fact that the California Buckwheat is going to seed and integrated this native species into the beer. The beer is a deep copper color, smooth and refreshing with a malty finish that has a touch of honeysuckle from the buckwheat.

breweries.name: Cismontane Brewing
breweries.description:
Cismontane Brewing Co. was started by two native southern Californians, Ross Stewart and Evan Weinberg. They chose the name Cismontane because the geographical area it represents, coastal Southern California from Santa Barbara to San Diego. As a brewery we are dedicated to creating the finest beers to represent the unique culture and diverse natural aspects of this region. Each beer is named after a local feature that is unique to the area.

The Brewery is located on the side of the largest mountain in Orange County in the city of Rancho Santa Margarita. The great views from Santiago peak and the trails through the canyons provide some of the natural inspiration for the beers and the company.

The brewery is small and accessible to all with a warm and comfortable tasting area. So don’t hesitate to come by when in the area.

(cis-mon-tane)

“This side of the mountains”, in reference to coastal Southern California. This was a common term used for Southern California while it was forming its identity during the gold rush and before prohibition.

breweries.name: Anheuser-Busch InBev
breweries.description: Anheuser-Busch operates 12 breweries in the United States, 14 in China and one in the United Kingdom. Anheuser-Busch's operations and resources are focused on adding to life's enjoyment not only through the responsible consumption of beer by adults, but through theme park entertainment and packaging.  In the United States, the company holds a 48.5 percent share of U.S. beer sales. Worldwide, Anheuser-Busch's beer sales volume was 128.4 million barrels in 2007.  The St. Louis-based company's subsidiaries include one of the largest U.S. manufacturers of aluminum beverage containers and one of the world's largest recyclers of aluminum beverage cans. Anheuser-Busch also has interests in malt production, rice milling, real estate development, turf farming, metalized and paper label printing, bottle production and transportation services.

data.name: Chippewa Valley Oktoberfest Lager
data.description: An Amber Lager. Clean caramel malt flavor and balanced with a touch of Saaz hops.

available.name: Seasonal

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Northwoods Brewpub and Grill
breweries.description:
Northwoods Brewpub and Grill brought the fine tradition of craft brewing to Eau Claire. Now the first microbrewery in west central Wisconsin is the place to be!

It’s all woodsy and warm in our lodge-like bar. Hang out with friends, shoot pool for free or melt into the comfy chairs in the lounge. Whether you want to let loose, play trivia or have an intimate conversation there’s a spot waiting for you. Did we mention the 14 tap beers? Your thirst stops here.

data.name: Copper Legend
data.description: Ancient timelines talk of dark days, plagued by hardships and Kingdom demands. When hope was all but lost, a legend emerged. A plumber. With copper pipes and an uncanny wit, he battled fierce foes and saw to the brewery’s opening. Our Octoberfest is malty, smooth and exceedingly drinkable. It is perfect to celebrate and honor today’s legends. We use locally grown wheat from MA, Munich malt and noble hops.

breweries.name: Jack's Abby Brewing
breweries.description: Jack's Abby Brewing was formally founded in January of 2011 by three brothers, Jack, Eric and Sam Hendler, who grew up in a family business. The ideas behind it, however, date back over ten years to when Jack was still in college experimenting with home brews. After graduating, Jack became the head brewer of one of the largest brewpubs in the eastern US. He earned joint diplomas in Brewing Technology from Siebel Institute of Chicago and Doemans Academy of Munich. Currently he is a member of the Master Brewers Association.

data.name: Dragonhosen
data.description:
Late at night in the dark cellar or among the rows of towering vessels at Boulder Beer, if you listen carefully you can hear the eerie sound of the Dragonhosen.

Brewed with generous amounts of Vienna and Munich malts for a rich, full-bodied malty flavor, Dragonhosen begins as a traditional Oktoberfest lager, then stealthily breathes fire with 9% alcohol by volume. Hallertau and Czech Saaz hops add balance with a mild earthy aroma and flavor with moderate bitterness.

If you find yourself at Boulder Beer, listen closely and beware… if you hear a scratching and scraping coming your way, the bite of the Dragonhosen is sure to follow.

breweries.name: Boulder Beer Company
breweries.description: Boulder Beer Company, Colorado's First Craft Brewery, was founded in 1979 when two University of Colorado professors applied for and received the 43rd brewing license in the United States.  The brewery has a full service pub that's open for lunch and dinner, with a spacious outdoor beer garden offering amazing view of Boulder's Flatirons. Brewery Tours Mon-Sat at 2pm, and Sat at 4pm.

data.name: Durango Colorfest
data.description: In the tradition of European Fest beers, Durango Colorfest celebrates the autumn season. Like the changing color of the leaves, our beer can change season to season. Brewed with the finest hops, malt and Rocky Mountain water, Colorfest, has become part of the "Durango Season".

breweries.name: Durango Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Durango Brewing Company is the third oldest microbrewery in Colorado. Brewing since 1990, our heritage dates to 1886 when Durango Beer and Ice Company became Durango Brewing Company. Our beers are hand crafted using the finest barley, hops, and yeast along with water born high in the San Juan Mountains of Southwest Colorado.

Presently our beers include Durango Amber Ale, Durango Dark Lager, Durango Wheat Beer, and Durango Golden Ale. We also brew Derail Ale, 2007 and 2008 Gold Medal Winner at the Great American Beer Festival (Other Strong Beer Category), and various seasonal beers. Seasonal selections include Blueberry Wheat, Durango Pale Ale, Durango Winter Ale, and 2009 GABF Gold Medal Winner - Colorfest, our fall seasonal.

In November 2007, we added our new Tap Room which has features inspired by the Narrow Gauge Railroad and the history of our town. The Tap Room is open seven days a week for all to relax and enjoy the Flavor of Durango. Stop by and try a sample or enjoy a fresh pint of any of our award winning beers. Our unique growlers are always available for carry out along with all our packaged products.

breweries.name: Abita Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Founded in 1986, the Abita Brewing Company is nestled in the piney woods 30 miles north of New Orleans.

In its first year, the brewery produced 1,500 barrels of beer. We had no idea what we started. Customers loved our beer! By 1994, we outgrew the original site (now our 100-seat brew pub) and moved up the road to a larger facility to keep up with demand.


We brew over 160,000 barrels of beer and 10,000 barrels of root beer in our state-of-the-art brewing facility. Our lagers and ales are brewed in small batches, hand-crafted by a team of dedicated workers with only the highest ideals of quality. This pride, along with our brewing process, is what creates our great brews.

We are privately owned and operated by local shareholders, many who have been with us since day one.

Abita uses only the finest ingredients – British and North American malted barley, German and American yeast strains, Pacific Northwest hops and the pure artesian water of Abita Springs.

In Abita Springs, we are blessed with the purest of water. Drawn from our deep wells, our pristine water is not altered in any way.

Abita Beer has no preservatives, additives or stabilizers and is cold filtered. The result is beer that is the finest and freshest tasting as proven by our loyal customers and great chefs of the south who use Abita Beer in their recipes.

breweries.name: Sherwood Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Sherwood Brewing Company opened its doors on August 31, 2006 in the Hayes Center Shoppes plaza on Hayes Rd. north of Hall Rd. (M-59) in Shelby Township, Michigan.

We serve only the finest hand-crafted beer, wine, and sodas, all made in our on-site brewing facility.

Sherwood Brewing Company is proud and honored to be the recipient of WDIV's "4 the Best" award for Best Brewpub for four consecutive years (2007 - 2010) as voted by you, our customers.

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Sudwerk
breweries.description: Sudwerk brews and bottles Swiss Beer in Zürich Oberland.  Unlike others that brew “Pale Ale Style”  Our beer is brewed on an Authentic British Pale Ale Brew House using the finest English Pale Ale Malt, American Hops and Yeast.  I have been brewing American Pale Ales since 1982, back in the days when I brewed 20 Liters at a time as a homebrewer.  Today I brew 2000 Liters at a time (more friends then back then).  I grew up in Northern California during the Microbrewery Revolution and you will taste that in my beers. Of course I never pasteurize our beers or add anything artificial.  Trust me when I say, Beer coming from Pfäffikon to your dinner table will taste fresher than beer brought in a container traveling 2 months over the ocean.  Don’t just take our word for it, Biergenuss Magazine calls us “The Rothschild of Beer”. Thanks to all of you for making Western Rider the number one selling Pale Ale in Switzerland. Unlike many other brands, we are not brewed in Germany or in another Kanton and then sold as a “Local” or “Swiss Beer”. We are also not a big beer factory, owned by a European neighbor.  With every Sudwerk Beer, you are enjoying an Authentic Pale Ale produced here in Switzerland, by a family owned and operated “Kleinbrauerei”/Microbrewery. With every Sudwerk Beer, you enjoy the true meaning of Swiss Quality and the results of good old fashioned hard work.  You can find us in larger COOP Stores in the German and French speaking parts of Switzerland, on the Bahnhofstrasse in Jelmoli, Rio Getränke, Drinks of the World as well as in over 100 Restaurants and Hotels. In Zürich, we are distributed by Heineken Distribution, Intercomestibles AG and Schatt Getränke. Quality without compromise. If you are ever in the neighborhood, come by and visit us!  And do follow us on Twitter and Facebook.

breweries.name: Kuhnhenn Brewing
breweries.description:
Founded in 1998, Kuhnhenn Brewing Company began as a homebrew supplies shop in the family's former hardware store while buildout on the brewery was taking place. 

The company has been producing countless award-winning beer, mead, and wine out of their 8-barrel brewery since 2001. In 2012, Kuhnhenn took home the Gold Medal at the World Beer Cup in the IPA category for their flagship offering, DRIPA, or Double Rice IPA.

The brewery  has expanded to capacity over the years, with only limited distribution in Michigan, New York City, and parts of Europe, in addition to taking part in festivals throughout the world. Construction is underway on a production brewery and second taproom in nearby Clinton Township, which will allow the brewery to get closer to meeting demand by increasing capacity more than 1500% overnight. 

Visit the brewery taproom for to-go sales of some of their award-winning products.

Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. breweries.name: Franconia Brewing Company
breweries.description:
With a brewing heritage that dates back to the 1800's, Franconia Brewing Company is more than just a local brewery, it's the essence of the true Bavarian brew. By combining the local accessibility of North Texas with our German/heritage/history we are going to provide the fine people of North Texas with a taste of some of the most genuine and freshest Bavarian beer available. 

Franconia Brewing Company not only delivers the freshest brews to your favorite restaurants, pubs, and taverns, we also have adopted many green practices to help improve the environmental concerns in North Dallas.

data.description: Beer creeps and lager freaks! Arise and taken possesion of this bewitched offering of the season crafted to lure your spirit’s deepest rapture. Conjured to exorcise the grim horrors of the armies of soulless drafts everywhere.

breweries.name: Deschutes Brewery
breweries.description: Founded in 1988, Deschutes Brewery began as a brew pub in downtown Bend, Oregon and is known for such brands as Black Butte Porter, the nation’s number one selling craft porter, and the popular Mirror Pond Pale Ale. In addition to its original Bend pub, this family and employee-owned brewery opened a second pub in Portland’s Pearl District in 2008. The company’s main brewing facility is located on the banks of the Deschutes River and is the nation's 7th largest craft brewery, distributing in 28 states, Washington D.C., and two Canadian provinces. Deschutes Brewery was named one of America’s Best Places to Work in 2013 & 2014 by Outside Magazine.

data.name: Gemuetlichkeit Oktoberfest
data.description:
Gemuetlichkeit translates from German as \the fondness of feasting especially those of us at the brewery.   Each September in the nearby city of Jefferson Wisconsin thousand turn out for Gemuetlichkeit Days a celebration of the area's German heritage.  We invite you to celebrate the spirit of Gemuetlichkeit with us.  Don your lederhÃ?Â¶sen kick up your heels with a polka and raise a stein of our Gemuetlichkeit Oktoberfest with a friend.  Ein Prosit!
Gemuetlichkeit Oktoberfest is a rich amber lager with a malty aroma and balanced hop bitterness.  This seasonal style is served at German Oktoberfests in liter steins.""

breweries.name: Tyranena Brewing Company
breweries.description:
he legend of Tyranena (pronounced Tie·rah·nee·nah) began long ago, in a time before history was written. Legend tells of a foreign tribe that built a series of stone structures and effigy mounds on the edge of a lake they called Tyranena.

Today, these structures lie preserved deep under the waters of Rock Lake. No one knows for sure who built them, the purposes they served, how and why they are now submerged, or even the meaning of the word Tyranena.

We invite you to develop your own theories while enjoying one of the new legends of Tyranena, the Legendary Wisconsin Beers of the Tyranena Brewing Company.

Ask for a Legendary Wisconsin Beer where you drink.

style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Comanche Creek Brewing Co
breweries.description: Comanche Creek Brewing Company is a small family owned microbrewery nestled in the Sangre de Cristo mountains of Northern New Mexico and located just out side Eagle Nest, New Mexico. Comanche Creek Brewing Company offers its take on several tradition beer styles including Alt and Kölsch styles. We utilize the pristine mountain waters of the Sangre de Cristo mountains to bring our customers great tasting beer. We hope you enjoy our hand-crafted beers the next time you are in Northern New Mexico!

data.name: Groomer
data.description: Originally brewed in winter of 2011 to help Snowbowl commemorate 50 years in business, this Wintermärzen was intended to just have a few runs. However, by popular demand, Bayern is offering this decoction-mash brew for more ski seasons.

available.name: Winter
available.description: Available during the winter months.

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Bayern Brewing
breweries.description: Bayern Brewing began in Missoula, Montana, in 1987. We are proud to be the only German brewery in the Rocky Mountains. Owner and Brewmaster, Jürgen Knöller, is a German Diploma Master Brewer. He began brewing in 1978 at age 16. The education that he received in Germany was a rigorous and lengthy one. It took eight years to advance from apprentice to journeyman to Master brewer. He focuses on quality and is truly dedicated to his profession. Combine his education, experience and personal dedication and you have amazing beer.

available.name: Fall
available.description: Available during the fall months.

style.name: American-Style Märzen / Oktoberfest
style.description: The American style of these classic German beers is distinguished by a comparatively greater degree of hop character. In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). Bread or biscuit-like malt character is acceptable in aroma and flavor. Hop aroma and flavor should be notable but at low to medium levels. Fruity esters should not be perceived. Diacetyl and chill haze should not be perceived.

breweries.name: Bonfire Brewing
breweries.description: Based in one of the coolest mountain towns of Colorado, Eagle, Bonfire Brewing makes beer (by "coolest" we mean, "neat," "nifty," and/or "fantabulous," not cold. It's actually fairly warm for the most part). We wouldn't describe our beer as face-meltingly good, maybe just face-warmingly delicious. It certainly encourages the use of non-existent adverbs. We started making beer because we needed more friends. Now our friends need more beer. So it goes.

In general the style is characterized by a medium body and broad range of color from golden to reddish brown. Sweet maltiness should dominate over clean hop bitterness. The bitterness should not be aggressive or harsh. Malt character should be light-toasted rather than strongly caramel (though a low level of light caramel character is acceptable). breweries.name: Falls City Brewing Company
breweries.description: Falls City Beer is back! An old Louisville favorite has returned with a whole new recipe. Falls City Original Pale Ale is now available at dozens of local bars and restaurants. The new brew is made in the style of Falls City Pale Ale from the 1930’s. Falls City began as a craft beer in 1905, made in small batches with only the finest ingredients. As we start again, 105 years later, we are once again a craft beer with a commitment to quality and taste.

data.name: Harvestfest Ale
data.description: A beautiful orange hue, our celebration of the annual hop harvest comes in the form of a modified version of our bready, biscuity Oktoberfest. We’ve taken the base beer and dry-hopped it FOUR times with freshly delivered Cascade and Columbus whole leaf and pellet hops. The result is a wonderfully complex hybrid beer, with aromatic citrus and piney notes paired to a smooth, malty flavor. EXTREMELY limited (only 5 bbls produced).

available.name: Seasonal
available.description: Available at the same time of year, every year.

breweries.name: Fort Bend Brewing Company
breweries.description: Fort Bend Brewing, Fort Bend's First Craft Brewery, combines creativity, the Texas state-of-mind, with high quality ingredients to make exquisite craft beers.

breweries.name: Red Hare Brewing Company
breweries.description: Situated in an 11,000 sq. ft. warehouse, Red Hare Brewing Company has a 20 barrel brewhouse with a 120 barrel fermenting capacity. Making every day beer for beer fans everywhere, Red Hare’s flagship beer is Long Day Lager. Other year round Red Hare beers are Gangway IPA and Watership Brown. Keep an eye out for our Rabbit’s Reserve Series, limited edition, one-off batches that will be released four times a year.

locations.name: Main Brewery
locations.hoursOfOperation:
Our taproom is open:
Friday: 5:30 pm - 7:30 pm
Saturday 3:30 pm - 5:30 pm

data.name: Hawktoberfest
data.description:
Our feature fall seasonal is Hawktoberfest! 

A beer brewed in the same style as those you would find in Munich hundreds of years ago... with an Iowa spin. Its balanced malt flavor and clean finish pairs perfectly with a crisp afternoon gathering with friends.

  

Let Munich have Oktoberfest. We have Hawktoberfest!

breweries.name: Backpocket Brewing
breweries.description: Backpocket Beer is German-inspired and hand-crafted right here in Iowa. We strive to provide Iowans with a simple, enjoyable world-class beer.
